page.title: 17LIFE STYLES 3
page.content: The Landlady of the "Dog and Duck" finds that trade is very{seasonal}and tied to the comings and goings of the {Caravan site}residents. In winter there are few customers, but with better weather the Caravan Owners start to arrive and{'Village'}life starts. The caravaners are a 'happy lot' and there are many characters among them, some of whome become {unofficial community leaders.}One, the 'Mad Welshman' is a beloved talking point. Things are dull by comparison when he is not on site. The only other regular customers are tent campers, and the boating and angling fraternities. They are most welcome, but the anglers do tend to be muddy and to favour antisocial costume and accountrements. Others at the bar beware of wet oilskins and maggots in the beer!
